meanings.definition: Convert (information or data) into a code.
meanings.sent1: I encoded my secret message to keep it safe.
meanings.sent2: The software encoded the sensitive information for security purposes.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally encoded my shopping list, now I can't read it!
meanings.sent4: Her smile encoded a sense of warmth and kindness.
meanings.sent5: The ancient map was encoded with mysterious symbols.

meanings.definition: Represent (a message or information) in a particular way by converting it into a code.
meanings.sent1: The spy encoded the top-secret document before sending it.
meanings.sent2: The encryption software can easily encode any text.
meanings.sent3: I tried to encode my phone number, but now I can't remember it!
meanings.sent4: His artwork encoded emotions that words could not express.
meanings.sent5: The coded message was so well encoded that only the recipient could decipher it.

meanings.sent1: She carefully encoded the instructions for the treasure hunt.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization used unique symbols to encode their history.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally encoded my password, now I can't log in!
meanings.sent4: His eyes encoded a silent plea for help.
meanings.sent5: The encoded diary held secrets waiting to be unlocked.
